measured_by: dichotomous comparative rating (Team E vs. Team Y)
justification: “After watching the animated stimulus display … participants completed a single comparative (dichotomous) rating of future performance: ‘Which of the two teams do you think will have the edge next season – Team E or Team Y?’”

measured_by: 11-point bipolar Likert scale (Team E vs. Team Y)
justification: “Participants provided comparative ratings of Team Y versus Team E on three 11-point Likert scales … The three ratings … referred to past performance.”

measured_by: 11-point bipolar Likert scale (Team E vs. Team Y)
justification: The same paragraph states that one of the three 11-point Likert scales asked, “If the two teams were to play against each other right now, which team would win?”—a direct measure of present performance.

measured_by: 11-point bipolar Likert scale (Team E vs. Team Y)
justification: Among the three 11-point Likert scales, participants also answered, “Which of the two teams do you think will have the edge next season?” indicating that future performance expectation was measured with this 11-point scale.
